description: Every single video I try to watch on this app shows an error that says "HTML 5 video not properly encoded"
I like the clean and simple interface. Too bad it doesn't support web extensions yet in the stable build. Its great for testing websites though for the moment, and occasional use.
summary: Great Application, Can't Wait for Extentions

description: It can run websites, you can search stuff, pretty much like any browser, but can't run certain websites correctly and freezes a lot. firefox is much better.
Would expect it to work righ out of the box without searching for optimization settings. Nice and minimal interface...but...very laggy, freeze constantly...slow and unresponsive
Need to improve performance. It's use a lot of cpu and laggy. Need to add extensions store to easy install extensions.
summary: Need to improve performance. It's use a lot of cpu and laggy

description: cannot delete cookies
Video player performance much better than before, but searc for images is garbage. Cant render smooth too many image in google results. Slow, laggy. :/

Very cool that there is someone else making a browser with somewhat meh engine but okay. Sadly PWAs on certain sites are amazingly laggy and virtually unusable. There is no image from clipboard pasting. Default SE is DDG which is now also bad, would suggest Qwant because it has so many more features. Can't change font nor font size. Something about FF that makes this still feel a little too simple :( Can we get video support please, so annoying when scrolling Instagram.

Browse is an excellent browser, that shines because it is fast and is well integrated with Gnome, both aesthetically and functionally, . It has built-in support for ad-blocking, and pop-up blocking, as well has saving passwords, and everything else you would expect from a modern browser. 
Plays all those html5 media you find on the web just fine, using the gstreamer backend.
The only downside to it is the lack of support for the popular extensions found in other browsers ecosystems. Hopefully that is in the roadmap!
I recommend it, and is my preferred way to surf the Web!
summary: Great browser, just lacks popular extensions support

description: The feature that I love most is that you can make web apps with eiphany(gnome web)

The web browser itself is pretty good and saves a lot of space for web browsing. However, I can't play youtube videos or any videos on the web under opensuse thumbleweed. So practically is useless for me. I hope they will fix this as soon as possible.

It's cool that Gnome is making it's own browser but it feels like it's waste of time. Mozilla and Google have lots of resources and new version of Epiphany comes out only every six months with few changes. And if you use distribution like Debian or Ubuntu LTS you end up with browser from ages ago because it's tied to Gnome. 
I would consider using it if it had at least synchronization of bookmarks and passwords.
summary: It can't really compete with firefox or chrome

description: If you're looking for a browser that is very well integrated in the GNOME environment, Web is the best option. I also like it's not trying to be another copy of Firefox or Chrome, but brings its own innovations. It's also the only open source browser besides Firefox and Chromium which keeps up with security updates.

Web is such a nice browser. It is clean, elegant, fast, ...

The only problems are its adblocker which doesn't block everything (but having it builtin sets Web apart from other browsers), and the fact that many websites/apps refuse to work with it, because they (incorrectly) detect the user-agent.
Its design and integration with GNOME is very good. It only needs a PDF viewer.
Good app because, good traduction in french and it works when I start youtube. But it's not stable.
Lightweight & reliable.

I have a love hate relationship with this browser. Small and lightweight.  It integrates perfectly with gnome.  Still has a long way to go before it can compete against any of the heavy weights like Firefox and Chrome.

My biggest irk with the app is that it tends to crash on sites that use flash heavily.
summary: Browsing the web the GNOME way

description: Unfortunately it lacks some extensions support.
It's fast and easy to use but it doesn't support extensions and pinning a tab.
summary: Fast and easy to use but lack some features

description: It freezes everytime it is opened. I can not use at all.
summary: Can not used in Arch Linux with Gnome

description: Exactly what you need for simple and fast browsing. With system integration and a minimal design, it makes it ideal and perfect from browsing on Gnome systems. Highly recommended!
Easy and lightning fast browsing. Includes a minimal Gnome design and system integration, making it perfect for Gnome users. Highly recommended to all.
I have been using it for almost half a year now. I can say it is the best looking browser - simple and polished, really fast and reliable. Haven't ran in any problems with it.
summary: Excellent browser for your Gnome desktop

description: on http://lenta.ru

I always a joy to use Epiphany with the native Gtk3-Toolkit it feels home, compared to Firefox and Chrome. And the engine behind offers Multi-Process-Tabs and state-of-the-art rendering. Some convenience features are missing (e.g. remove entries from the auto-suggest).
freemail.ukr.net cause crash of the browser.
After initial install with default settings, most web pages crash the app within seconds or after a few clicks.  These same pages load repeatedly without crashing with Firefox 50.1.0

From the moment you open the browser you can tell: this is designed for GNOME. So if you like the GNOME interface, with Activities, topbar icons, and panel menus, you will love GNOME Web.
It's not perfect though; for example it has issues with dark themes.

Could be much better but the main hook to this is its great integration with Gnome 3. When you search in the overview it will show "Web" searching the web for what you search and is only decently fast.

Use it for basic things but YouTube and other websites may encounter problems that Firefox or Chrome would simply lack.

Epiphany is one of the first applications i install on Fedora Workstation and i flag it as the default web browser even though i am an old time Firefox user and i do this to have means of checking something quickly without messing with my Firefox session with 1000 tabs opened, Epiphany is ideal for that type of situation and i hope if Fedora would ship with Epiphany by default and users will install their heavy duty browser of choice afterwards.
Due to a recent instability in Firefox I tried Web and like it. Still missing some features and some things like the bookmark editor are a bit clumsy. Most sites work well.
If want a RAM sucking Trojan magnet that builds huge cache files in just a few hours then by all means use this program.
summary: This browser is a security risk

description:
Excelente para navegação simples. Ocupa pouco espaço na tela, dando sensação de monitor maior. 
Não é compatível para acessar sites de bancos no Brasil. 
Altera o volume sem nossa permissão. 
Precisa melhorar, ainda há várias instabilidades.

Great for simple navigation. It takes up little space on the screen, giving a bigger monitor feel.
It is not compatible to access websites of banks in Brazil.
It changes the volume without our permission.
Need to improve, there are still several instabilities.
Pretty sure this might be my favorite browser ever
Love GNOME Web. I'd prefer it to Chromium and certainly Firefox if it had extension support for Enpass.
summary: Beautiful browser, but need extension support

description: if you looking for faster browser and very light this browser will be the best choice
work perfectly.
Very good but could be better.
its great as a complementary browser.
This is a great browser, could use some more bug fixes but it's a really good alternative to google chrome
…some privacy oriented solution. Cookie auto-deletion (for sites which you did not log-in perhaps?) would do the trick I think.
summary: Very nice and clean, but miss…

description: This web browser just feels right. I wouldn't use it on its own, I would use opera or chromium as well, but sometimes it is nice to do some casual browsing in this environment.

This integrates well with Gnome, feels very fitting, etc. But beyond that it's no reason to move away from Firefox. There are no extensions, no customization new tab page, no bookmarks toolbar option. It feels like a pet project rather than a real contender. It would be good if the devs here could work with Firefox to integrate that into Gnome better, rather then try and reinvent the wheel of the browser. It pains me to give a low rating to a FOSS project, this says nothing about the devs or the quality, just about the real world usage.
summary: Integrated well with Gnome, but that's it

description: diden't work !

works great except bug with firefox account not synching as it should. Hope this bug will be fix soon.
Thx
summary: finally the flatpak version on my arch distro

description: it's a really nice browser that has an impressive amount of polish, which is only crippled by the lack of any extensions.
Arch user here. Fresh install, done it a few times now. I only use this to remember how to install brave and then remove it when im done with that. Wouldnt recommend 0/10
summary: Causes system crash after around 5 minutes of use

description: Youtube video playback is laggy. The play and pause actions are also lagging as oppposed to other browsers. Often gets a blank screen when the video resolustion is changed to a higher one.
Looks like Safari browser!
Follows the Gnome principles and fills a gap in my desktop-big-picture
This clean browser ui gives Microsoft Edge a run for its money!
summary: Clean and integrated into Gnome, just how i like it

description:
Overall, GNOME Web or Epiphany works well. It's amazingly fast, plays all my video streams (thanks rpmfusion) and the privacy functions are ok. 

My main concern is the bookmark system that is just not good. I work with a lot of bookmarks. I have on Firefox directories and subdirectories with more bookmarks in it, depending on the subjects I work with. When importing all my stuff to Gnome Web with Firefox sync, all of my subdirectories became main directories (tags). 

I'm a bit lost with that, since I have over 400 bookmarks in at least 90 directories and subdirectories on Firefox.
So in my opinion, Gnome Web lacks in having a good bookmark manager like Chromium and Firefox have

But it's perfect for normal every day use. I'll use it as my main browser and will continue with Firefox for my working stuff.

Another weak point are add-ons/extensions, the built in privacy functions are average good. I prefer having Privacy Badger, the ddg-essentials and uBlock for that

If the developpers fix those two issues, Gnome Web will be a super browser
summary: Overall very good. Only two things missing

description: I waited 3 hours to download a couple of files and now I cannot locate them. The docs are outdated, find / -name doesn't come up with anything, even in root, and there's no mention of download directory in the app preferences. It blows my mind that this piece of garbage is available to download without this very basic feature. 0/5.

I use two different browsers, one for "fun" and the other for study and work . This is the one I use for work because I love the simple design and the fullscreen button. It have all I need for simple research on internet and video-lesson online. However I would not use this for important stuff like online banking or other stuff that can be more dangerous than searching on blogs and stackoverflow and videolesson websites.
summary: I use it for study and work

description:
Trying to load any webpage and it seems like there is no attempt to load it. Just spits out an error.
But when it works, it is a lifesaver!
Download Size: 1.8GB ?

For whatever reason some websites (example Outlook on Office365) load in legacy mode, not in modern web app mode. I didn't see any way to override the UserAgent. So much for using this app to install web apps into app menu (create FreeDesktop .desktop file).
summary: Some websites load in legacy mode - web app not even detected

description: Feels outdated, and makes itself your default browser without asking

Let's start with the things that I'm missing/not so happy about:

1. Based in Apple's WebKit. Defaults to Apple maps when showing thumbnails.
2. Missing Bitwarden extension, or some sort of integration, for passed auto-completion.

Now the things I like:

1. Minimalistic
2. Fast
3. Great integration with GNOME and Wayland.
4. Same Dev tools than Firefox.
summary: Great minimalistic alternative to the big two browsers

description: I have tried other browsers too, this browser is lacking extension, but it was faster than edge, chrome, firefox. It is good for reading and very minimalistic. Now this is my default browser.
It would be alot better if it has feature like what Firefox already offered us. I'm not going to switch yet because it doesn't have extensions and DoH, will wait until then.

As of Apr-2021 many popular and modern public sites do not properly work in the browser. Layout is different, complains on certificates, some actions not working...So it is good browser to prove there might be an alternative but for now it is just waste of efforts.
Can't install web apps like it does on apt package.
I installed with Fedora 34 Beta, but my camera is not working. I dont know what to do. If the issue is solved, I wuold move to Gnome Web.
Great app, would recommend.
pages are not loading

The browser is based on Safari's open source KHTML fork WebKit with a simple API
Unfortunately, the GNOME team has a lot of work to do besides one little browser (Settings, Desktop, Shell, GNOME_Terminal, Screenshot tool, Tweaks AND MORE!) so extensions will take some time, with the API, Software, source code https://gitlab.gnome.org , GitHub Mirror etc
summary: Good alternative for Firefox, Chromium or Konqueror

description: love it, last update is such a great improvement.
Web application not available. I will try dnf install.
This browser will not play Amazon Prime videos.
I really love the minimalistic design, the built-in adblocker, and the fact that it's very lightweight and consistent with my GNOME! I am definitely switching to this one.
i wish this web browse is able to play the video of html5 format
summary: i want to watch video of html5,but this brower has no ability now

description: when I launch it my pc just crashes

After being annoyed by other browsers constantly adding features I'll never use, it's nice to see good ol' Epiphany still kicking the way it should.

I'm not much of a cloud-sync/video streaming fanatic, and I like that GNOME Web stays out of my way and keeps it simple.

Even if you don't plan on using it as your daily driver, there's no reason not to have it around as a backup in case another browser fails.

Highly recommended.
Love it. This should be the default on all GNOME-based distros.
Permissions must be set for each site. Chromium with ad blocking and HTML5 blocking extensions is better.

good stuff, but improve the tab switching please
its good. but the tabs are hard to see. small improvement would make loads of difference!
The best browser

had to enable Dbus acces thru Flatseal to use Firefox SYNC though.
Might help you out there !

+ Not Chromium-based
+ The engine isn't broken
+ Nice GTK UI
+ Supports Firefox Sync

- No custom (installed in run-time) extensions... Ones I really need are: Bitwarden, the unofficial ProtonMail extension, JSON viewer, BTTV, Medium Unlimited and React Developer Tools.
summary: I still can't switch to it

description: I would love to switch to it but need support for extensions.
It's slow and scrolling is laggy. I'm just going to use firefox-gnome-theme for now.
Compared to MS Edge, it is super slow and choppy. Not smooth at all, especially YouTube page.
Good browser but returns a 404 server error every time its supposed to update to a new version.
I love the UI, the essential options. I wish I could use it as my main browser but it keeps on crashing on YouTube or whenever I'm playing videos of any kind.
Very slow and not responsive, could be a good choice if been more faster
Today's web is just too complicated for Web. A shame, as it does a few things better than firefox- better two-pinch zoom, nicer interface, more gestures...
I am sure that it does not displays correctly some websites
This browser definitely needs more support to counter Blink. Its great, supports Firefox Sync and does what it needs to.
was the poor performance a concious design choice or what

I love that GNOME Web is native, fast, and streamlined for the GNOME desktop. If you haven't used it in a few years, give it a try again. There are some minor compatibility issues with websites not playing nice (like videos on Twitter), but overall it's a solid and speedy browser.

For a FOSS web browser, it's quite impressive:
-Built in privacy and ad blocking tools
-Simple UI
-Firefox Sync
-GNOME oriented layout

Only downsides are: 
-Lag from scrolling
-No PiP
-No plugins, themes, or extensions (I know, this is quite a luxury) 
-Some crashes and stalling

Most of all, it's FOSS! Looking forward to future updates and fixes!

Der Werbeblocker ist Lichtjahre entfernt von Alternativen wie zB ublock origin usw. 
Das scrollen fühlt sich sehr "ruckelig" an, ab und an kleine Gedenkpausen (1-3 Sekunden) wenn man mit der Seite interagieren will während sie noch geladen wird usw. Ansonsten ganz okay, vor allem fügt er sich sehr gut in den Gnome-Desktop ein, sieht gut aus und ist nur mit dem nötigsten ausgestattet.
Ab und an leider viel langsamer als Firefox oder Chrome.

Epiphany wird immer besser, chlank und prima aufgeräumte Oberfläche, perfekt in GNOME integriert, inzwischen auch stabil genug für den täglichen Gebrauch. Der Zugriff auf die Lesezeichen könnte noch vereinfacht werden mit separatem Button in der Headerbar. Die Unterstützung von X.509-Client-Zertifikaten fehlt leider noch und u.a. ein paar andere Sicherheitsapekte verdienen noch Beachtung.
summary: Inzwischen tauglich für den Alltag mit kleinen Abstrichen

description: Wenn man die Einstellung des Browsers erst suchen muss, also ich habe nicht gefunden, wo ich cache und cocies einstellen kann, dann spricht das nicht gerade für Seriösität.
this stuff lacks all serious functionality.

"Lo sentimos. Parece que navegador web epiphany ha dejado de funcionar.": a alguien más le pasa? He probado desinstalando, reiniciando el computador e instalando de nuevo y nada, sigue saliendo el mismo error. Comenzó a suceder después de actualizar a f25 v.v
Es muy buena si estas usando Debian.

Excelente en Debian! 
Anda muy fluido y se integra perfectamente al tema del sistema, me sorprendió gratamente lo simple e intuitivo que resulto ser y su interfaz muy bien trabajada.
summary: Excelente en Debian, anda muy fluido y se integra perfectamente!

description: Me encanta la fluidez, sencillez a la hora de buscar, es rapidisimo.

Después de imprimir en firefox la página "https://servers.opennic.org/" que no me resultó nada aceptable, lo probé con esta otra aplicación. Totalmente satisfactorio. Lo único que por ahora no he visto ver el aspecto antes de imprimr.
5435353fddsfffhnj

Me gusta mucho, a mejorado mucho en las ultimas versiones.
Seria excelente que tuviera compatibilidad con web extencion, aunque en particular lo que mas necesito es la posibilidad de traducir las paginas o una parte del texto.

Saludos!
summary: Muy bueno, me encanta tener el mismo aspecto en todas las aplicaciones

description: A mi le gusta este navegador porque es descarga mas rápido.

Me gusta, pero Eolie es mejor a mi parecer, igualemente cuenta con el mismo problema al usar webkit y python no reproduce contenido con DRM, le haría falta eso, y ademas un mejor bloqueador de publicidad y traductor incorporado, quizas la posibilidad de plugins o opciones de "bloqueo" avanzadas no sería mala... En fin sigan mejorando buen trabajo!

Es un excelente navegador, para los que dicen que "No tiene HTML5" estan errados, HTML5 es un estandar web de lectura de etiquetados y plantillas de estilo, lo cumple de pie a cabeza, si no puedes ver videos es porque no tiene DRM y eso no tiene nada que ver con la decodificación de metadatos de la web, simplemente es la decodificación de un video por falta de un codec privativo o un medio para procesarlo, toda pagina que no requiera DRM se puede ver video sin problemas...

Buenos Días, mucho gusto este navegador se integra muy bien con gnome, ha mejorado mucho, sin embargo el bloqueador de anuncios integrado carece de eficiencia, el renderizado de páginas es algo lento, a pesar de estar basado en firefox no dispone de compatibilidad con sus extensiones.
Espero que siga mejorando, tiene un futuro brillante...

Navegador sencillo y funcional.
Para ciertas tareas sencillas va fenomenal.
aunque tiene problemas reproduciendo videos, aun así es 10/10

Génial, très rapide pour lancer et utilise : 1% de ressources par rapport à Firefox qui grimpe vers 50% !!

parfois il y a une image qui ne marche pas mais cela n'est pas dérangeant.
Navigateur parfait, fonctionne super bien. On ne peut pas trouver mieux.
Super navigateur web 100 % libre avec bloqueur de pub intégré. Seul le manque de délimitation entre onglets ouverts est à regretter.
Не хватает некоторых функций, вынесенных на верхнюю панель. Например вкладок. А так замечательное приложение
Хороший веб-браузер только один - это отсутствие расширений и все же + 5 быстрый, удобный а это я считаю главные моменты.
Похож на Safari.
Замечательное приложение рекомендую
Как пользоваться данным браузером ? Ни в какую не хочет на Endless OS 3.9.5 открывать страницы.

Работает в Fedora 35, Gnome 41.3/Wayland.
Не хватает тёмной темы, но это уже придирки. Со своими задачами справляется на все 100%.
